document_data.caption: A map of Malatra showing the site of Mhou.
document_data.name: Mhou
document_data.mainbody: '''Mhou''' was a town in [[Laothan]] in [[Malatra]].{{Cite interactive atlas|C2aNElc.FCW}}
document_data.Geography: The town was located in the far northwest of Laothan, on the border with [[T'u Lung]], opposite the [[We'peng Garrison]].
document_data.Description: Mhou existed only to serve as a stronghold against T'u Lung.
document_data.Economy: In the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]], Mhou enjoyed hardly any external, legitimate trade.
document_data.Law & Order: The town did have a criminal trade, however, operated by local [[yakuza]]. People of Mhou undertook covert raids into T'u Lung, where they would not only steal livestock but occasionally women for [[slavery]] and [[prostitution]]. They sold their victims to certain nobles of the [[Nuyen]] clan or trafficked them via caravans southward, even to [[Kataburi]] in the neighboring [[Kuong Kingdom]].
